title: Create config profiles
description:
Create YAML config files for all environments. Base config has sensible defaults. Profile configs override only what's different.

**Profiles**:
- local: Debug logging, telemetry disabled, relaxed timeouts
- dev: Info logging, telemetry to dev collector
- qa: Info logging, telemetry to QA collector
- test: Minimal config for tests, telemetry disabled
- prod: Warn logging, telemetry enabled, strict timeouts

**Files**: configs/base.yaml, configs/local.yaml, configs/dev.yaml, configs/qa.yaml, configs/test.yaml, configs/prod.yaml
**Acceptance Criteria**:
- All profiles exist
- Base has complete config with defaults
- Profiles only override necessary values

title: Implement OTEL Gin middleware
description:
Implement Gin middleware for OpenTelemetry.

**Requirements**:
- Creates server spans for each request
- Extracts trace context from incoming headers
- Records request metrics (latency, status, method, route)
- Adds trace_id to response headers (X-Trace-ID)

**Metrics to record**:
- http.server.request.duration - Histogram
- http.server.request.total - Counter
- http.server.active_requests - UpDownCounter

**Files**: internal/platform/telemetry/middleware.go
**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Spans created for each request
- Trace context propagated
- Metrics recorded with proper attributes
- X-Trace-ID header added to responses

**Validation rules**:
- server.port: required, min=1, max=65535
- server.read_timeout: required, min=1s
- log.level: oneof=debug,info,warn,error
- telemetry.endpoint: required when telemetry.enabled=true

**Files**: internal/platform/config/validation.go
**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Uses go-playground/validator
- All config fields have appropriate validation tags
- Error messages include field path and reason
- Validates conditional requirements

title: Implement config loader
description:
Implement koanf-based configuration loader with load order: defaults → base.yaml → {profile}.yaml → env vars.

**Config structure**:
```go
type Config struct {
    App       AppConfig       \`koanf:"app"\`
    Server    ServerConfig    \`koanf:"server"\`
    Log       LogConfig       \`koanf:"log"\`
    Telemetry TelemetryConfig \`koanf:"telemetry"\`
    Auth      AuthConfig      \`koanf:"auth"\`
}
```

**Files**: internal/platform/config/config.go
**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Load order is correct (defaults → base → profile → env)
- Env vars with APP_ prefix are loaded
- All config fields have appropriate types
- Function signature: Load(profile string) (*Config, error)

title: Implement context-aware logging
description:
Implement helper for extracting logger from context and enriching with request-scoped data.

**Functions**:
- FromContext(ctx) *slog.Logger - Get logger from context
- WithContext(ctx, logger) context.Context - Store logger in context
- WithRequestID(ctx, requestID) context.Context - Add request ID
- WithTraceID(ctx, traceID) context.Context - Add trace ID

**Files**: internal/platform/logging/context.go
**Acceptance Criteria**:
- All functions implemented
- Logger in context includes request_id and trace_id
- Safe to call with nil context (returns default logger)
